problem.p: A block of mass M has an initial speed v (as shown above). It slides a distance d along a rough surface with coefficient of kinetic friction \( \mu \). The block then collides with a massless spring of spring constant k. The block compresses the spring a distance x along the surface (which is still rough) before coming to rest. The goal of this problem is to determine the speed v in terms of the other quantities. What is the most appropriate way to decompose the problem?
